title: General Grant National Memorial: Park Home
body: "Let Us Have Peace."  The final resting place of President Ulysses Simpson Grant and his wife, Julia, is the largest mausoleum in North America. It testifies to a peopleâ€™s gratitude for the man who ended the bloodiest conflict in American history as Commanding General of the Union Army and then, as President of the United States, strove to heal a nation after a civil war and make rights for all citizens a reality.              Apps for National Parks of NY Harbor.   Put a ranger in your pocket! Our apps include walking tours, historic photos and info to help you focus your visit to New York Harbor parks. History of the Tomb   The memorial to two-term president and defender of the nation is a great place to learn a little bit more about the history of America.        The Civil War and the NPS   Want to learn more about the Civil War? There is no better place than in the areas it was fought, many of them administered by the NPS.
